sentences.sContent: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.
sentences.sCn: 我紧紧抓住他的胳膊把他带走。

sentences.sContent: Alan grasped the handle and pulled it.
At that time, we did not fully grasp the significance of what had happened.
sentences.sCn: 当时，我们没有完全明白所发生之事的重要性。

sentences.sContent: Luke took her arm in a firm grasp and led her through the gate.
sentences.sCn: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊，领她进了门。

sentences.sContent: Her grasp of the issues was impressive.
sentences.sCn: 她对这些问题的领悟能力极强。

words.tran: 理解，领会（grasp的现在分词形式）；抓紧，抓牢

remMethod.val: 他见到她宛如抓住(grasp)一根救命稻草(grass)

trans.tranOther: to take and hold something firmly

trans.tranCn: 抓住；抓紧；理解力，领悟力
trans.tranOther: the way you hold something or your ability to hold it
